name: French Onion Cabbage Soup
description: A hearty French onion-style soup with cabbage, topped with bread and melted cheese.
instructions: In a large saucepan or soup pot, bring broth to a boil.
Transfer cabbage and onions, along with cooking juices, to boiling broth. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes.
Drain cabbage and onions, reserving the broth. Ladle half of the cabbage and onions into a large, deep oven-proof casserole dish.
Arrange 4 bread slices on top and strew with 3/4 of the cheese. Ladle 1 1/2 cups of reserved broth into casserole.
Add remaining cabbage and onions on top and ladle remaining broth.
Top with remaining bread and cheese and dot with remaining butter.
Bake until cheese has melted and crust is golden, about 15 minutes.
notes: Recipe text appears to be partial - may be missing initial ingredient quantities.
